verses.text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, Neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
Have mercy upon me, O Lord; for I amweak: O Lord, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
My soul is also sore vexed: But thou, O Lord, how long?
Return, O Lord, deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercyâ€™s sake.
For in death there isno remembrance of thee: In the grave who shall give thee thanks?
I am weary with my groaning; All the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
Mine eye is consumed because of grief; It waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; For the Lordhath heard the voice of my weeping.
The Lordhath heard my supplication; The Lordwill receive my prayer.
Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: Let them return andbe ashamed suddenly.
